Description: Fragment of neck and oval handle to sharpish turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-buff; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 166 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '218'. Name Aristodamos. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 1098.26.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (66)
